H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3250.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = a person who responds to allegedly negative behavior of others in the form of an accusation or a verbal rebuke

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H247.def: = to wear a belt or girdle around one's waist

H2504.def: = area located on both sides of spine between false ribs and hip-bone; ◄ part of human body; ≈ often used to indicate the entire waist region of the body; euphemism for male genitals

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H7561.def: = state in which humans are or are considered to be in a state of guilt before God or humans, ◄ as a result of (allegedly) having acted in a way that is contrary to the law

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H1347.def: = dense growth of shrubbery or small trees, habitat of animals

H1363.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H1935.def: = state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority

H1926.def: = state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1343.def: = state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1343.def: = state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans

H3665.def: = action by which humans show a low estimate of their own importance, usually before a deity

H1915.def: = causative action by which someone causes someone else to fall down through an act of violence; ≈ possibly associated with humiliation

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H2934.def: = action by which humans cause themselves to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H2280.def: = state in which something has been wrapped around part of someone's body

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H930.def: = a large wild animal, sometimes identified with the hippopotamus but more likely to denote the elephant or a mythical monster

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1241.def: = large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H202.def: = state of being physically strong and healthy which usually includes the ability of producing children

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H2180.def: = the hindmost part of an animal's body, extending from the backbone; ≈ sometimes associated with insignificance, especially when compared to the head

H2654.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H730.def: = evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength

H1517.def: = a piece of tough fibrous connecting tissue uniting muscles to bones ► and so forming the inner framework of the body

H6344.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H8276.def: = state in which cord-like objected are twined together, resulting in additional strength

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H650.def: = river bed that contains water in the rainy season only; ≈ considered as deceptive as one never can never be entirely sure as to whether they contain water or not

H5154.def: = a yellowish-brown alloy of copper with up to one-third tin, ≈ regarded as a hard and difficult to bend

H1634.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish tissue that together constitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H4300.def: = a long, rigid piece of metal

H1270.def: = a strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence

H7225.def: = point in time at which an event starts happening

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H5066.def: = state in which objects are close to other objects in space

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H944.def: exact meaning discussed; = a portion of some part of nature, which is understood as having produced it; the final shape is instrumental for people and animals in some contexts

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H6628.def: = thorny plants of about 1.5 meter high, bearing small, yellow fruit; ◄ |iZyziphus lotus|i*, found in the northern part of the Jordan Valley and in Samaria

H7070.def: = a tall grass with stiff, sharply-pointed leaves and a plume-like flower head that reaches to more than 2 m; it grows in lakes and streams, the roots creeping across the bottom of the lake to produce new leaves and stalks; or on riverbanks; ◄ Phragmites australis (Common reed) or Arundo donax (Giant reed); ► used for baskets, mats, flutes, pens, arrows, and roof-coverings; ≈ symbol of weakness and undependability, but also flexibility

H1207.def: = an area of low-lying land which is flooded in wet seasons or at high tide, and typically remains waterlogged at all times; a place where {L:reeds<SDBH:קָנֶה>} and {L:papyrus<SDBH:גֹּמֶא>} grow

H6628.def: = thorny plants of about 1.5 meter high, bearing small, yellow fruit; ◄ |iZyziphus lotus|i*, found in the northern part of the Jordan Valley and in Samaria

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H2648.def: = process by which humans or animals are overcome by a sudden uncontrollable fear or anxiety resulting in a frenzied hurry to run away

H3383.def: = river; ◄ flowing from Mount {L:Hermon<SDBH:חֶרְמֹון>} in a southerly direction through the {L:Sea of Galilee<SDBH:כִּנֶּרֶת>} into the {L:Dead Sea<SDBH:יָם־הַמֶּלַח>}

H5344.def: = causative action by which humans use a sharp object to make a hole through an object

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H4170.def: = contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
